item.title: Aquino starts four-nation European visit in Spain
item.description: (UPDATE 1) President Benigno Aquino III kicked off his visit to Spain on Sunday (September 14) with a wreath laying ceremony at the replica of the Rizal Monument at the Avenida Islas de Filipinas in Madrid. A series of meetings followed, including one with Spain's former Prime Minister Jose Maria Aznar and the Filipino community in the Spanish capital.

item.title: Luis destroys P58M worth of corn, rice in Isabela
item.description: (UPDATE1) Typhoon Luis didn't stay long, leaving only minimal damage to infrastructure. But it will leave a big blow what is known as the rice and corn granary of the north. In Isabela, at least P58 million worth of corn and rice in several plantations were destroyed.

item.title: NBI busts child-trafficking trade at clinic
item.description: (UPDATE 1) A newborn child was rescued from the hands of a midwife – just as she was about to sell him to the illegal trade. Agents of the National Bureau of Investigation Anti-Organized and Transnational Crime Division (NBI-AOTCD) arrested Resureccion Franco and her husband Florendo at a birthing clinic in Las Piñas.

item.title: Typhoon Luis slams northern PH, cuts power lines
item.description: (Update 2) Typhoon “Luis” (international codename: Kalmaegi) slammed the northern part of the Philippines on Sunday (September 14), cutting power and communications lines and forcing people to flee to higher ground, national disaster agency officials said.

item.title: Typhoon Luis to exit PH before noon Monday
item.description: Typhoon Luis continues to move away from the country and is expected to be out of the Philippine Area of Responsibility (PAR) before noon Monday (September 15) towards the direction of Vietnam or southern China, according to PAGASA's latest weather bulletin.

item.title: 3 dead in ferry mishap off Southern Leyte
item.description: (Update 1) Three people were killed as rescuers searched for at least three others still missing with more than a hundred rescued after a ferry sank in waters off Southern Leyte, the government said Sunday (September 14).

item.title: Signal No. 3 up in 9 areas as ‘Luis’ pummels N.Luzon
item.description: (Update 1) As expected, Typhoon “Luis" made landfall in Northern Luzon early evening Sunday (September 14), pounding Isabela and its nearby areas, the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) said.

item.title: 658 passengers stranded due to Typhoon Luis
item.description: A total of 658 seagoing passengers in Southern Luzon were stranded on Sunday (September 14) due to rough weather caused by Typhoon Luis, the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) said.

item.title: Manila lifts truck ban
item.description: After almost seven months of standing pat on imposing a truck ban in the country's capital city, Manila Mayor Joseph Estrada finally relented on Saturday (September 13) and lifted the controversial ordinance.

item.title: PH starts inquiry into Filipino militants in Syria
item.description: The Philippines is investigating the involvement of Filipino Islamists in the three-year civil war in Syria after two locals were reported killed fighting for Islamic State militant group, an intelligence official said on Saturday (September 13).
